11.content:
It's been quite a long time...You're finally returning to your hometown. Your family had to move when you were younger, but now you finally get to move back. The same streets, the same buildings and shops...It's like nothing's changed. You can't wait to explore the forest you always played in when you were a kid. It was your one and only happy place whenever you felt sad or hurt. But, something just doesn't seem right. As you unpack your things, you get the feeling that someone...or something is watching you...

Lucky! Your parents have to go out for the entire weekend, so you've got the whole house to yourself! You put on a change of clothes and head out. When you reach the forest, you suddenly get the feeling that there's something horrible waiting for you there. You brush it off as you think it's just your imagination. You walk past some trees, until you finally reach it, you're childhood secret spot near a cliff...Only to find a large cabin right there. You feel like your heart's been torn out. Who would do something like this? This was your favorite place in the whole world,and now it's been taken away from you. As you feel your sadness slowly be replaced by rage, you decide to find out who's responsible for this.

You calmly walk up to the door, only for it to be opened up for you by two six-year old kids. One was a girl with long blonde hair with a smile on her face. The other was a boy with short black hair with a smile on his face too. "Welcome sir!" They shout at you. You're completely taken aback by this. They 'show' you inside, forcefully shoving you in. "Excuse me, but where's your manager?" You say, trying to keep a calm voice. The two point to a reception desk at the other side of the lobby. As you approach the receptionist, you see that it's a twelve-year old boy with brown hair, watching you with a happy look on his face. "Um, hi. I'd like to speak with the manager." "I am the manager! My name is William. Wil for short." It all just get's stranger and stranger. "What would you like to talk about?" "I'm here because I've got a complaint." "I'm sorry, but to file a complaint here, you have to stay for at least a couple of days." Didn't expect that, but you're thankful that your parents had to go for the whole weekend, so you decided to stay there for the weekend.

"That's great! And since you're our first customer, I've decided it's all expenses paid, free of charge!" You get a cold chill the moment he finishes talking. Is there really something watching you from somewhere? But you don't wanna pass up an all expenses paid stay here! "Now then, just sign your name here on the guest list,and we're all good to go." You hesitate signing it a little, but you manage to do it. "Now then, Luke will show you to your room." You get a very bad feeling as you hear footsteps coming closer and closer. You feel like all the warmth in your body is replaced with an intense cold feeling. You look to your left to see a black-haired boy, about Wil's age, wearing a long black cloak covering his neck down to his ankles slowly walk towards you. You can't seem to explain it, but you're scared of this guy. There's just something not right about him. "Come with me." He tells you. You'd better not make him angry and do as he says.He leads you to a hallway,until you reach the first door to the right. "This is your room." You open the door to see a large, clean and rather stylish looking bedroom. "The bathroom is to your left, the closet is right across the bed, and out the window is the sea. Enjoy your stay." He bows down to you before leaving. As you close the door, you suddenly feel a whole lot better. Well, now what should you do next? You forgot to eat breakfast, and you're feeling a bit tired from being with Luke, and you've still got a lot of questions to ask that William guy. What to do, what to do...

You wander around until you find a door that reads 'Cafeteria'. Your stomach growls and you remember that you didn't eat anything this morning! You decide to head inside to get something to eat. It was all expenses paid anyway.
Inside are lots of round table with chairs, all of which are empty. "They weren't kidding when they said that I'm their first customer..."

You walk up to the main desk and look at the menu hanging on the wall. "Hello there! What can I get you?" You look at the worker, which turns out to be another kid! This one has red messy hair. "My name is Gill, since it sounds like my favorite Digimon character. I even dyed my hair the same color! So,what would you like?" "...Um...Can I ask what this 'Lupine Special' is?" "Oh,that...It's a tender steak cooked to a sizzling juicy crisp mixed with a few spices to give it that special 'Bow wow' to it!" "...Well, what about the 'Avian Special'?" "It's a vegetarian meal, mostly fruits and berries, mixed with a an exotic flavoring that can really give you a 'Bird's eye view' in food!" "Okay...This just keeps getting weirder and weirder..." "Did you say something?" "Ah,what about the 'Reptile Special'?" "Oh,that one is a delicious prime rib grilled to perfection, and a special ingredient in it will really give you a 'Rip snarling' good time!"

You can't help but feel that Gill keeps adding a bunch of animal puns in the food names, but you also have a bad feeling about eating any of this...Your stomach start gurgling again. You have to eat something!

1111.content:
As you order the Lupine Special, Gill immediately starts cooking. You sit down on a table and watch him moving around the kitchen, cutting, slicing, adding spices, and all that other stuff. As he adds the finishing touches, You watch as the two younger kids walk in, curiously looking around the cafeteria. You wave your hands to them as they run towards you and take a seat around you. "So, I never knew who you two are. What are your names?" you ask.

"My name is Akira! I got it from a show my older brother once watched." the boy said. "My name is Elly, I thought of it myself!" the girl says. You try to smile nicely to the two as you think of how weird they got their names from. As Gill carried the dish on the table, you saw from the corner of your eyes a sad look flash from the two. "What's wrong?" you ask. "No-no...Nothing..." Akira says. "Don't eat it!" you hear Elly whisper to you. You look at her with a suspicious look on your face. The smell of the steak wafts into your nostrils and your mouth starts salivating in an instant! You grab the knife and fork and start wolfing down the dish as fast as you can. Speaking of wolf, it seems that after every bite, light blue fur is sprouting from your skin. Not only that, but claws are growing out of your hands and feet! After you finish the whole steak, you take notice of the changes just as a furry blue tail suddenly bursts out of your pants! You look at yourself in disbelief! Snout, fangs, pointed ears on your head, everything! But your clothes still fit you, and you can still stand on your two legs, and your hands are still shaped like hands too!

"Wh-what the heck just happened to me!?" you yell in disbelief, immediately standing up. "Um, I think you turned into a blue anthropomorphic wolf, I believe." Gill says, closing his eyes and putting his hand on his chin. "What'd you mean by that!? Can't you see that I just transformed into some furry freak!?" "Hey, that's not nice!" "Yeah!" You look down to see the two six-year olds with an angry puffed-up face looking at you. You realize you just insulted them somehow and give a sigh. You kneel down to one knee and look at them. "I'm sorry if I offended you. I'm just a little...surprised that I turned into this." The two let out the air in their mouths before saying "Okay..." to you, looking away. "Anyway," you say, getting to your feet. "Why did this happen to me? What caused this?" You ask Gill. "It was the food. The name was a heads-up on what will happen to you if you eat it." You think about it for a while before saying to Gill, "Is there a way to reverse it?" "I'll have to ask Wil about that." he said before leaving.
1111.title: A Fur Raising Experience

11112.content:
As you watch Gill head to the exit, you decide to follow him. After getting his attention and saying good bye to Akira and Elly, the two of you leave for the Lobby. After a few minutes, Gill stops in his tracks and suddenly blurts out, "Wait, how do we get back there again?" You stare at Gill with a look of shock and confusion on your face. "You mean to tell me that you don't know how to get back to the Lobby!?" "Yeah, I haven't been outside the cafeteria for a while since breakfast..." You just stare as you watch Gill begin to reminiscence whatever it is he's thinking of. A smile appears on his face, he closes his eyes and you see a bit of drool starting to overflow out the corner of his mouth. You can feel your anger towards him grow more intense, until you just start growling at him, which snapped him back to his senses. "Oh, sorry. I was just remembering the yummy flavors of all the food I ate."

The two of you continue on your way across various hallways and doors, until you finally make it back to the lobby. Gill immediately runs over to Wil, who was reading a magazine on the couch. "Wil! I thought I'd never get back here alive! D'you have any bread?" "Gill, I thought you're supposed to be at the cafeteria!" "Well, I had to escort our guest here because he has a request for you." You walk over to the two, surprising Wil a little bit. He quickly regains composure and asks, "So, what is it you need from me?" You explain what happened to you and ask for a way to reverse the wolf transformation. "Sorry for asking, but why would you want to go back to being human?" "Why? What do you mean why!? I'm a blue wolf person!" "Light blue." Gill chimes in. "W-Whatever! Just, change me back to a human, please?" "Like I said, why would you want that? You're much stronger as a wolf anthro, and you still have your original mind, so you won't lose control over yourself. Not to mention your increased senses. What's stopping you from wanting to stay like this?" "Um, maybe it's because of the fact that I LOOK LIKE A TOTAL FREAK HERE!!!"

Both Wil and Gill suddenly get an angry look on their face. You've definitely offended them somehow. "Sorry, but even if I wanted to, I can't change you back." "W-why not?" "Because, 1. You're kinda mean when it comes to normality. 2. I don't have a means of reversing the effects of the food." "Yeah, and you're really mean when it comes to looks, too!" "Gill, I already said that." "Oh, right." You sit down on the couch, trying to accept the change that has befallen upon you. Does this mean that you'll be like this for the rest of your life? No, it can't be! Right at that second, you started smelling something weird...Smoke? No wait...Ashes? Whatever it is, it's something around that. You think that there may be a fire that broke out somewhere, but the two kids in front of you start smelling the air. "Hey, does that smell like smoke to you?" Gill said. "Now that you mention it, I do remember asking him to practice his aim at the gym..." "You don't think..." You're not sure just what the two are talking about, but you know that it has something to do with another employee here.

The two tell you to stay in the lobby as they leave to go check something in the gym.

111121.content:
"Might as well try to keep them happy, after what I said back there." You stay on the couch, examining the coloring of your fur. After a while, you can hear the footsteps of someone approaching you. You look towards the direction of the sound and see...Luke! You can feel it. Your instincts are screaming in your head, telling you to get away from him, as fast as you can! You watch him as he calmly strides over to the lobby table. He looks at some papers and begins sorting them out. "Come on...Get out of here...Before my instincts start acting up by themselves..." Your legs start twitching, ready to sprint out of the lobby the moment you give them the command. When he finishes sorting the papers, he looks at you. A horrible cold chill was sent down your spine and lasted for at least 10 seconds. "Grrr..." He walks up to you and looks at you in the face. "Have you seen Wil anywhere?" "...He...He's with Gill...At the gym. He said something about...Someone practicing his aim." "...Am I using too much power?" You look at him inquiringly. Just staring at his eyes is making your limbs feel numb. "Allow me to adjust." Suddenly, you can feel your limbs again. You can breathe easier and your legs have stopped twitching. But you still feel like getting far away from him. "How...did you do that?" "It's something I can do, which I don't like to share with others." You watch as Luke starts to leave and disappears around the corner. "Something he can do, huh?"

After half an hour, you hear someone else coming. You see Akira and Elly come around the corner, and you wave to them. "Hey! Mr. Wolf-man!" "Mr. Wolf-man!" They run towards you and start asking a bunch of questions. "Where's Wil?" "Where did Gill go?" "How's it like being furry?" "Are you enjoying your stay?" "Do you think I should change my shirt?" "Do you brush your teeth after every meal?" You try to get their attention, but they continue to barrage you with random questions. "Did you see Luke again?" "Isn't he scary?" "How come he always wears black?" "Did you try to rip him apart?" "Do you think he's actually nice inside?" "Have you seen our dragon yet?" "STOP!!!" You pant a little as the two just stand there looking at you. "...Okay, I don't mind answering some of your questions, but please, one at a time! Wait...What was that last question?" "You mean about brushing your teeth?" Elly asks. "No, that other one." you say. "You mean...the dragon?" "Yeah, that's the one." "Uh oh..." Akira and Elly look at each other before running to the corridor Wil and Gill used. This left you frustrated and confused.
111121.title: Another meeting

1111211.content:
The more you think about the way those two just took off, the more you want to get answers from them. "Aw, to heck with that guy Wil!" You bound after the two, trying to see which direction they went to. That is, if there weren't so many darn corridors here! What kinda stupid cottage house is this!? You suddenly smell something...You try sniffing the ground...This must be their scent! You follow the trail, hoping that doing this will lead you to them. As you continue to follow them, some thoughts began entering your mind. "Hey, isn't this like how wolves would go around hunting for prey to kill?" You concentrate on blocking out the 'kill' part in that last statement. "Heh, I guess the wolf part of me is starting to leak a bit..."

After a while of trailing Akira and Elly's scents, you reach a pair of double doors with a bit of smoke coming out of the tiny space in between the two doors. You look up at the sign above, which read 'gym'. "Hmm, I wonder if they'll get mad at me for not listening to them..." Your knees start trembling a bit, and your fanged teeth are chattering a bit. "Ugh...Luke must be around here...Probably inside..." You open the door slightly, being careful not to make gap too noticeable. You peak inside and see Akira and Elly jumping up and down, saying something. Your ears can't quite understand what they're saying, but you do hear some stray words like "sorry!" and "didn't mean-" and such. You push the door a little bit further and you see Wil and Gill, bending over someone with a red shirt. You push the door just one more time, and see Luke. He suddenly turns to face you, making another cold chill cover your spine. He quickly walks over to you, and you feel desperation and panic instantly wash over you! You try to move, but as you watch him come closer and closer, your muscles seem to be locked at just the mere sight of him. As he fully opens the door, you just stand there, sweat rolling down your furred head as he inspects you top-to-bottom. "It seems that I've just caught myself a little doggy without his chain." You gulp as he grabs you by the neck of your shirt.

"Sir, I've found someone that shouldn't be here." Luke says, dragging you to the others and pushing you to the floor. "Hmm? What are you doing here? Shouldn't you be back in the lobby?" Wil says, looking down at you. You open your mouth, trying to answer, but your voice feels constraint, like something's keeping it inside you. "Alright, that will be enough Luke. You can go check if there's any suspicious activity going on somewhere else." "As you wish, sir." You watch as Luke leaves the gym, and a breath of fresh air enters your lungs. You breath heavily for a few seconds before looking around you. Wil, Gill, Akira and Elly are all looking at you. You also see someone with blonde hair and a red shirt doubled over behind a few feet away. "Okay, why did you come here? Didn't we tell you to just wait in the lobby?" Gill said. "Well, see, These two...uh, they mentioned something about...a dragon?" The two suddenly look at Akira and Elly, who look at the floor apologetically. "Yeah, and?" Wil asked, looking back at you. "I just wanted to ask a few questions, so I followed them." There was a silence in the gym. That was when there was a splutter and a gasp coming from the blonde kid! You all come to his side and help him up. "Is there anything I can get for you?" Gill says. "Are you alright?" Elly asked. "*cough* D-don't worry. I'm fine..." He stands up on his own and sees you. "Oh! A guest?" You nod. "Well, my name's Drake. Nice to meet you!"
1111211.title: Chasing your prey

11112111.content:
You look at Drake, looking like he was caught in a bomb explosion. His red shirt is slightly charred and there's black smudges on his face and arms. His blue pants are even torn at the edges as well. "Are you sure you're alright?" you ask. "Don't worry, I'm fine. Really." he says, standing up on his own. "I told you, be more careful when practicing your aim!" Wil said. "Yeah! What would we do without our big, lovable dra-" Will hits Gill in the ribs before he could finish that word. You already know that he was going to say 'dragon' there. "Um, I think I already know what he was gonna say, Wil." you say, hoping for the best. Wil didn't look very surprised, but Gill looks completely shocked. "Wha? N-no! I wasn't gonna say that!" "Then what were you saying?" Elly asked. "I-I was....gonna say, uh...Dra...Dra...Meh, I've got nothing." Gill says, admitting defeat.

"Well, how about we let the pup and the lizard get to know each other?" Wil said as the four left the gym. You turn to Drake and ask "Is it really true? You're a dragon?" Drake just looks at the ground and nods his head. You normally would have laughed at it, thinking it's a joke, but after being turned into a wolf anthro, and seeing the scarlet-red eyes at the boy in front of you, pretty much anything is possible at this point. But still, a human like him as a fire-breathing dragon? "C-can you...uh, show some proof or something?" "Step back, I'll use half my power."

You do as you're told and watch as he clench his fists and look like he's focusing on something. You see it! Red scales covering his arms and face. His hair starts bunching together, turning rigid and becoming his yellow horns. His faces pushes out into a muzzle and you see a pair of wings and a tail burst out of his clothing. The wing membrane is a deep blue color. As he relaxes, Drake looks at you, waiting for your reaction. "W-wow...That's amazing!" "You...don't think I'm a freak?" "If I was a human, I might have. But either way, it's still pretty cool!" "Gee...thanks a lot. It really means a lot to me." Drake says, a smile forming.

The two of you sit at the bleachers, getting to know each other. "You see, all of us aren't human. We just wear disguises in order to interact with other people." "Huh. I guess that's why the others got mad at me when I said I look like a freak." "Don't worry. None of them can really blame you for thinking that. It's just a natural reaction from, you know...Changing species..." The two of you talk for a while until the doors of the gym open, with someone coming in. It was Akira and Elly! "Big brother!" "Big brother!" The two run over to the dragon anthro beside you and gives him a big hug. "Alright, now what's the problem?" Drake asks, rubbing Akira's head. "It's Luke again!" Akira says. "He's so scary!" Elly says. "Now now, don't worry. He'd never hurt you two, alright? He's just not very good at playing with others. Now run along before Wil starts wondering where you two are." You watch the the two kids run out the gym. "Wow, you seem to be good with kids, huh?" you say. "Yeah, I've always seem to be like the 'big friendly dragon that can beat up the creatures of the night' sort of figure for those two." "What about the others?" "Wil usually doesn't care as much. Gill's more like a playmate. Luke's too scary for them, and Lyle is too much of a trouble maker." "Lyle?" "Our lifeguard and apparently our scientist. He's the one who causes all the transformations here in this cabin." Drake says. An idea forms in your head. If he's the cause of all this, then can he undo it all as well? "Hey, where can I find him?" "Well, he's either in the pool taking a dip, or messing up your room." You suddenly feel a twinge of intense anger from that last statement. You start growling at the mere thought of someone inside your territory, doing whatever he wants in there. "Hmm? Oh, right. I think wolves are territorial creatures, right?" "Shut up and take me to him right now! If he thinks he can just waltz into my room, MY ROOM!" "C-calm down! We're not even sure if he's heard of you yet!" You take a few deep breathes and feel some of your anger fading. But you still have to decide where to go, however.
11112111.title: The More Friends, The Merrier

111121112.content:
After taking a few deep breathes, you look at Drake and say, "Alright. I'm calm. Now take me to where he usually is. Hopefully, he really hasn't heard about me at all."
Drake nods and heads out the gym. You follow him out to the hallway, where Drake starts going down one corridor.

After a few minutes, the two of you are standing outside a door with a sign on top, which read "swimming pool" on it. The two of you walk through the glass doors and see the sun shining down on a large pool area, which almost looked like a part of some 5-star resort! There was a large curved pool with a lifeguard chair next to it, a large glass ceiling over the whole room, a few coconut trees around, an entire beach-side bar on one side! And several tanning chairs around the pool. It seems that one of them is occupied, with a 12-year old boy who looks oddly like Luke, only he's wearing a pair of blue and white trunks, and seems to be asleep. Drake approaches him and nudges him awake.
"H-huh? Oh, Drake! How nice of you to visit me." he says.
"Okay Lyle, I've got a question to ask you, and you'd better answer it." Drake says.
You approach the two and look angrily at Lyle, who also looks at you, but doesn't seem fazed at all.
"If I messed up Wolf-man's room? Nope, I'm a bit busy reorganizing some formulas and quadratic equations in my head right now."
He closes his eyes again and seemingly goes to sleep, which only enrages you. You suddenly grab him by the shoulders and start shaking him.
"Alright! Tell the truth! Did you go near my room or not!?"
"Ugh, I said no. Now will you please let me go back to sleep?"
Drake places his scaly hand on your furred arm, and you let go of him.
"Well, could you at least turn be back human?" you ask, calmer this time.
"Well, alright then. But there's a guarantee that it won't work."
"What do you mean by that, Lyle? Is this another one of your tricks?" Drake asks.
"Basically, I've been doing a reverse transformation potion research in my room, but so far, all it does is give you a bad case of the runs. Yeah, I think that's idiot for diarrhea."
You reel back your arm to punch him, but Drake instantly grabs you from behind, holding you back by the shoulders.
"Okay, I think that's enough now. C'mon guest, lets go."

You two are standing in front of the bar now, away from Lyle.
"So what am I gonna do now, Drake!? I really am stuck like this forever..." you say, whimpering.
"It's okay, it's okay. For now, all you can do is enjoy your vacation. Here, I'll get you something from the bar." Drake said, pointing at the bar.
"Oh no, this time, I'll pick what I wanna get, and I am not gonna turn into some kind of half-breed wolf creature."
As you walk to the bar, you can hear Drake mumble that you already are one, but you ignore him.

When you reach the bar, you see Gill cleaning a glass with a blue rag.
"Gill!?" you exclaim.
"Oh! It's you! Uh, um...The guy who sorts the mail, right?"
"What? What are you talking about? It's me!"
"Of course I know you! I was just playing with you, Mr. Blue Dog-man."
"Now I'm Mr. Blue Dog-man?"
"Heheh, Just kidding. So, you want the Lupine Special?"
"No! Not that again!" you say, grabbing the counter.
"Alright! Alright! Jeez, I was trying to make a joke. That's all."
You look at the menu at the back wall of the bar. Most of them are labeled with the word 'special' at the end, which must mean that they are transformation dishes again. Though when you looked at the drinks, they all had one thing in common...Well, two in common anyway. 1 was that none of them had 'special' at the end. 2 was that you haven't heard of any of those drinks before in you life. Wanting to play it safe, you tell Gill,
"I'll just have something to drink."
"Great! What would you like?" he says, tying the rag back onto his left arm.
Turns out it was the bandanna he always wears. But for a split second there, Your eyes spotted something on his arm where he tied his bandanna back on. You couldn't get a good view of it, but it was definitely something...
"Hello? Your order?"
"Huh? O-oh! Yeah! Um, I'll have..."

A T-rex, a blue dog, a werewolf, and a crocodile...Wait, what is he doing exactly? You look around the lobby to make sure no one else is around before approaching Wil. "Hey, what are you doing?" you ask. Wil looks up from the board and sees you. He starts to giggle a bit and moves the crocodile piece in front of the werewolf piece. "I said what are you doing?" He laughs a bit louder this time before looking at you again. "I'm setting the board to match the playing field." What? You wonder what he meant by that. If he moved the pieces around when he saw you, does that mean that the crocodile piece represents you? If so, that means he's the werewolf piece. "Who are the other pieces?" You think out loud. "The T-rex is Gill, and the blue dog is Luke." he says, still smiling. He moves a large white bird piece onto the board on a nearby square. "And who's that?" "Someone who looks like my faithful dog. I believe he has claimed your territory his own." You tilt your head a bit to the side, trying to understand what he meant by that. "What if the squares represent a room here?" Wil says, seeing your confusion. If he's saying what you think he's saying, then someone must be in your room right now! You widen your eyes in realization of this fact. You run back to your room, no longer caring if anyone else saw you like that.

As you reach your room, you see water seeping out from under the door. You open the door and step inside, only to see the entire room is flooded with water! On the soggy bed lay a boy that looks just like Luke, only wearing a white shirt, pants and glasses. "Well well well, here comes the guy's latest play thing." he says, sitting up on the water-soaked covers. You feel anger filling every scaly inch of your being. Who the heck is this guy!? And what has he done to your room!? "You know, while you were gone, I made the place more suited to your physical needs. No need to thank me." he said, standing up to bow down to you. "What the hell have you done to my room!?" You shout at him. He seems to be surprised at your reaction. "What? You mean you don't like it, Mr. crocodile-man?" "No! I don't!" You grab him by the shirt and open your mouth wide, ready to snap it shut with his head inside. "Now now, no need to go wild on me. I just thought you would feel better if your room supported the needs of a crocodilian guest." Now that he mentions it, you do kinda feel more at home with a wet floor. And you feel calmer just standing there with such a humid atmosphere. You decide to let the guy go and back off a few steps. "S-sorry..." you say, a bit embarrassed at almost going feral a moment ago. "There now, wasn't that hard to be civilized, now was it?"

As the Luke look-alike sits back down on the bed, he starts laughing. "Heheheh, sorry about that. I just can't believe that my gracious 'leader' would focus more on mind alterations than on physical changes." Is he talking about when you turned into a crocodile from the food back in the cafeteria? "You know how I turned into this?" you ask. "Of course I do! And, I know a lot more about our little group and our plans and goals. If you'd like, I'll tell you more about it." You nod your head. "Alright then, but you have to do something for me first." He takes out two test tubes from his pockets, filled with differently colored liquids. "These two potions I made have varying effects. I'd like you to test one of these out for me." One test tube was blue in color, and the other was white. "Which would you choose, blue or white?"

It kinda tastes like blueberries. As the last drop of the potion falls down your throat, you give back the empty test tube to the Luke look-alike, who puts both tubes back in his pockets. He begins adjusting his glasses and watches you carefully. That's when you feel it...Raw power building up inside of you. You look at yourself in the water's reflection and see yourself...still the same as before. "Hey, what gives?" you say, looking at the guy. "Just wait a moment. Muscles take time to reconstruct themselves into a larger mass after all." You look back at your reflection, only to see your arms a little...wider? You look at your arms directly and see biceps slowly puffing up under your scales, and it's getting really big too! The sleeves of your shirt are already getting a bit tight, and your legs are kinda hurting too. You look down to see them beginning to strain your pants as well. Must be your leg muscles growing too! As the changes continue, you can't help but flex your right arm, shredding the sleeve up to the shoulder. Not only that, but you're still growing! You turn around to see your tail...It's getting longer and thicker, but you guess a tail is just one big muscle anyway. "Get ready!" he said. You look at him with a confused look. You suddenly feel a burst of power inside you. Like an instant, Your clothes burst to pieces, no longer able to contain all that reptilian strength. You look at your body, flexing an arm to see just how big it was. Luke's look-alike is still watching you carefully. As you look at your full-body reflection in the water, you marvel at how big you've grown! You could barely fit through the doorway now! And...You're also naked...You immediately turn away from the Luke look-alike, even though there really isn't anything visible, thanks to the scales acting as a secondary layer of skin.

"Now now, there's no need to be so modest." "What do you mean there's no need? My clothes are all too small to fit me now! How can I not be modest, especially with you watching me the whole time!" "Heheh,I'm not into that sort of filth, if that's what you're thinking." "Oh yeah, you still haven't told me your name." "I'll tell you once you turn around and face me." You slowly turn to the side, then face him completely, only to be blinded by a bright flash of light. Hey, he just took a picture of you with a camera he was hiding in his back pocket! "Heheheh, I'll put this photo in the 'success' file." "Hey! Why the heck did you just take a photo of me!?" "I always take a photo of my experiments, so I can keep track of it all." He stands up and puts the camera away. He suddenly changes to a more serious look, which eerily looks like Luke's face. "My name is Lyle, the lifeguard. At least, that's the job Wil gave me when we built this cabin. Believe me when I say that Wil is someone who you must never mess with. He's a wild monster underneath his kind exterior. Believe me, I know. But I'm sure you've met someone who knows that side of him even better than me." You remember seeing the huge scars on Gill's arm. "But, what does he even want? And why do all this to me?" "I believe I can't tell you that. He's always watching us, thinking ahead of us by at least 2 or 3 steps." You remember the chess board Wil was playing with back in the lobby. "Anyway, I'm also Luke's twin brother, which is why we look so much alike. I think he has the most information about Wil than the rest. You'll want to talk to him, but you have to watch what you say, or you'll regret it."

You gulp as Lyle finally exits your room. You start thinking about what to do next. If Luke is the one who knows the most here, then you'd better call him. You pick up the phone next to your bed and press the button there (there's only one, and it's labeled 'room service'). After about a minute, there's a knock on the door. "Come in!" Luke enters the room, pausing when he saw it flooded with water. When he sees you, he widens his eyes in surprise to see you as a huge, muscled, anthro crocodile. "Well, it looks like you ate at Gill's cafeteria, and you must've met my twin." You nod, feeling a bit nervous and embarrassed. "So, what is you need sir?" "Um, I just have some questions to ask." "Very well then, but first..." Luke starts rummaging around under his cloak, looking for something. At least, that's what you think, since you don't really see what he's doing under there. He pulls out a brown tattered loincloth and shows it to you. "You might wanna wear this first." "Uh, don't you have anything else?" "It's the only one I have with an adjustable size, sir. And I'm sure you like showing off your muscles anyway, the way you're currently...dressed." "My clothes burst when I grew, okay!" you shout, taking the loincloth and strapping it on your body.

Something's odd here. Why do you feel fine with Luke in front of you? Shouldn't you be having a hard time breathing right now?
1113111.title: You Got Big!

11131111.content:
You sit down on the bed, which creaks to the weight of your new muscles. Luke closes the door behind him and walks in front of you before folding his arms and looking at the wet floor. "Alright, what is it you need to ask." "Right, I need to know more about Wil, and what his plans are." You feel a cold chill crawl up your spine as Luke stares at you directly in the eye. He's not even scared at your new form! But, you still don't feel the intense cold feeling when he's nearby. "I'm afraid I can't tell you that. Anything else?" "Uh...Alright, why is it I feel...well, kinda fine right now, even though you're right in front of me?" Luke closes his eyes, as if to say he's thinking of a proper response to tell you. "I'm not currently exposing my strength at full capacity right now. You could say that the feeling you keep experiencing is my true power, leaking out of me. Right now, I'm bottling up as much of it as I can, which is why you're not feeling anything right now." His true power? It was leaking out? What does he mean by that? Before you can give a reply, he gives you a quick glance, instantly silencing you. "You don't want to know what my true power is. Not until you've stayed here for at least a day...That's when Wil wants to show you more of what we can do."

You're completely speechless right now. Luke is supposedly "powerful" ? So much so that he's trying his best not to radiate it so much? And these kids...or whatever they are, are able to do more than turn your body into this? Who the heck are they? "I...I want to know who you all are. And what do you want!?" You stand up, rising up much higher than Luke, but he's completely unfazed. "I told you...I can't tell you that." "Well at least tell me who YOU are!" "Hmph...You need to know that I've handled creatures far stronger than you." You suddenly feel the same intense feeling from Luke as before, but...it's different. You could barely move now! "I'll just let you feel some of my true power." Your body starts to feel heavy...Very heavy! You fall on your knees in front of Luke, who's just watching you, like a statue. Your body continues to get heavier, falling flat on the floor, seeing something under his cloak - blue fur...You see something that resembles blue fur! Your body feels light again. You stand up, panting, looking at Luke. He's still staring at you with his unblinking eyes. This time, you notice a white spike protruding right through his chest. "Wh-what the...blue fur...a spike..." "Darn, so you noticed." The spike immediately retracted into his cloak, as if it was never there before. "This is all the information I can give you. Now, you must be feeling tired, dear guest. I believe you've had a rough day today." Your body feels tired from experiencing Luke's aura. You fall backward to your bed. You hear the door open, and Luke's voice ahead of you. "My piece is the blue dog for a reason. My body was created with the form of the Aura Pokemon. My true name...You will learn it another time." The door closes. Luke must've left the room. Your body feels so tired from Luke's aura. So...tired...
11131111.title: This is why he's the blue dog...

111311111.content:
Everything is so blurry...So many distorted images...You can't seem to make anything out...So...Tired...Is this a dream? Maybe...Or, have you been dreaming and now you're awake? You can't really tell..."Hey!" So tired, can't concentrate..."Wake up!" What is that? So noisy..."Hey!!!"

You sit up right on your bed, feeling like someone pulled you out of a trance. You look beside you to see the two younger children working here. "Y-you two...Who are you two?" "It's us, the ones who you met back in the lobby, remember?" The blonde girl said. You think back to yesterday...Yes, they're the ones who you saw open the door and greeted you into this place. "Can...Can I ask what your names are?" "I'm Akira, and this is Elly." the boy said. "Akira...Elly...What...What happened to me?" "Well, we saw Luke tell Wil something, you see." Elly said. "Then, Wil told us to come to your room and wake you up." You start feeling better now, knowing that Wil at least's cares enough to get someone to check up on you. You look at yourself again. You're still a muscled croc anthro, and you're still wearing nothing but a loincloth. You notice the two kids staring at your body, curiosity in their eyes. "Why are you two looking at me like that?" "Well...What happened to you?" Akira asked. "Last time we saw you, you were less muscled...and human!" Elly said, poking your chest. "It's...it's a long story. I really don't wanna go into detail." Elly continues to poke your chiseled torso, then beckons Akira to do the same. "Hey Akira! You've gotta check this out! His muscles are so big!" "Really? Well make some space already!" Akira starts squeezing your biceps while Elly is massaging your legs. "Um, guys..." You feel really awkward with the two enjoying your muscles like it's a once-in-a-lifetime chance for them. Akira is now pressing his hands on your abs, with Elly checking out your shoulder length. "Guys, please, stop." They don't seem to hear you, as they continue to grab your biceps like crazy. "Hey!!!" you finally shout, grabbing the two by their shirt collars. You hold them up in the air as they struggle to get free. "Okay, I'm sorry I have to be rough with you two, but I need some personal space here for now." You set them down on the wet floor. They look at each other and bow down to you. "We're sorry!" they say in unison. You're actually a bit surprised by this, but you forgive them. You sit back down on your bed and try to remember all the events that happened here. "What's wrong?" Elly asks. "Nothing, just thinking."

"You know, if you have any questions, then feel free to ask us." Akira says. An idea instantly pops up in your head. How about you try asking THEM what you need to know! It might be a little risky though, but it may be worth a try.

"Hey, uh...I actually do have some questions to ask." you say. The two lean forward to listen. "...Can you two tell me anything about Wil?" The two look at each other and shake their heads to you. "Sorry, we can't." Akira said. "He'll get mad if he finds out." Elly said. It was worth a try, but you decide to keep asking. "Look, I really think that Wil is up to no good, and Luke is helping him! To go against him is to go against all of us, even if we don't want to." "The others might know what Wil is planning, but they won't speak about the matter, like us." Elly said. You think hard for another question you could possibly ask them. Then, a memory of Luke's blue fur and chest spike suddenly pops into your head. "Luke had blue fur and a spike on his chest...What is he?" "...He's the Aura Pokemon." they say in unison. "Yeah, I know! he told me that before he knocked me out cold! He also said that he'll tell me his true name soon! Does that mean anything?" The two greeters stay quiet for what seemed like a very long time. Eventually, Elly said something. "Have you played Pokemon Diamond or Pearl yet?" "No, the copies are usually sold out by the time I visit the video game stores." "His body was modeled after a certain Pokemon there." Akira said. "Okay, so he's a Pokemon. What about you two?"

The door suddenly bursts open, revealing Gill at the door. "Heeey!" "Big brother!" the two said,hugging Gill. "What's up guys? Who's this one?" Gill stares at you in the eye for a few seconds before Akira shouts, "It's the guest, silly!" "Really!? Wow! You've been working out?" You shake your head, not quite sure whether he was messing with you, or he really thought that you've been exercising. "Anyway, Drake asked me to come look for you two." Gill told the two greeters. You think for a moment. Drake? Who was he? Another employee here? You watch as the two 6-year-olds leave the room, leaving just you and Gill in your room. "So tell me, how'd you get so big so fast?" "Oh, well, I met Lyle." Gill suddenly loses his smile, turning into an angry frown. "Lyle? Did that jerk do anything bad to you?" "He flooded my room." you say, as if the news was years old. "Hmph. That guy gets on everyone's nerves. Only Luke is the guy that can keep him on a leash that won't break." he says, anger definitely in his voice. He sighs and looks at you with a smile again. After a long explanation of meeting Will, Lyle making you drink that muscle growth serum, and Luke coming in and knocking you out, you finish with Gill staring at you. "Wow, they must really love messing with you." he says. "Yeah, seems like it. Anyway, I have a few questions right now." you say. "Alright, ask me anything!" "What is Luke, really?" "I said hold your hands up."

11131111111.title: Catching Up

choices: You press him for more information.

111311111112.content:
You decide that you need to gather more information. Getting out of your room, you decide to head to the lobby for now. When you reach it, no one is there. It was empty.

"Huh...Wil and Luke aren't here..."

You see a board sitting there on the front desk, you approach to see that it's the same board you saw Wil using before. The pieces aren't there anymore, so Wil or someone else must keep it with them. Not seeing any reason to stay, you decide to head out elsewhere. Walking down a random hallway, you search the area. It takes you quite a while, but you soon reach a set of double doors with the sign 'pool' above it. You push it open and are astonished to see a huge resort-like room inside the cabin!

"Wow...Just how big is this place?" you say to yourself.

"Meh, it's pretty big...Or pretty small. It all depends on what Wil wants it to be."

You turn to see Lyle in the corner of the pool, just standing there in the water, watching you.

"Great. What do you want?" you say.

"Aww, is that how you thank the one who gave you your wonderful physical strength?" he said, a mocking tone in his voice.

"..."

You just ignore him and approach the bar that was just a bit away from the pool. You look at the menu, seeing quite a number of things similar to what you saw back in the cafeteria.

"Great. Only thing missing is if Gill is the bartender..."

"Anyone say my name?"

You turn to the corner behind the counter, and you see Gill walking out into the open, a blue rag cleaning a mug. At this point, you were a little surprised.

"Gill? But, shouldn't you be in the cafeteria? I thought you were the chef there!" you say.

"I am! But I also have to work as the bartender here too. Anyway, want something to drink? Dragon's Firepower? Tiger's Blood? How about the Belly-Filler? Whichever takes your fancy, I'll make it for you." Gill said with a smile.

"Careful, the drinks are made from my special serums!" Lyle shouts from the pool.

You wanted to ignore that, but since you've already been changed twice now, you already know not to trust anything these kids give you.

"Look, I just wanted to look for information about Wil. I mean, what the heck is up with him? Does he have some kind of control over you all? I..."

"You really shouldn't be sticking your snout into our business. Luke will not hesitate to turn you into designer shoes." Lyle warned.

"I'm afraid that's right. If you delve too deeply into our lives, Wil may decide to make your stay permanent, with no hope of return." Gill said, setting the mug down.

You look at the rag in his hands, which he ties onto his left arm...Wait, you saw something there. You didn't get a good look, but that bandanna is being used to hide it. Whatever it is, it seems that Gill doesn't want anyone seeing it.

"Come on, honored guest. You should just relax! Take a dip in the pool, or try a drink or two!" Lyle said, climbing out of the water.

You turn to him, wanting to give a retort, but you stop to see something incredibly weird. His belly...It was the shade of blue, like the ocean. And, there seemed to be a white tail sticking out behind him. When he turns to the side, walking towards a lifeguard chair, you can see that it is, in fact, a tail. And there are small blue protrusions sticking out of his back, too.

"Unreal..." you whisper.

"Heheheh, I'm letting you see them, to show you that there's more than meets the eye. We may be children, but we are so much more than you think..." Lyle said, his eyes shifting and focusing on you.

He gives a light chuckle as these strange features on his body disappear, sinking into his human body. You look back at Gill, who was staring angrily at him.

"Is that...Normal?" you ask.

"Yes. It's normal. I know his attitude can really get to you, but that's just how he is." Gill said.

"No, I mean...Those things. Was that...Was that a part of his real body?"

"Hmm? Uh...I'm not allowed to say any more."
111311111112.title: Detective Work

choices: Forget physique! Have some of that right now!
No, you have more important business to return to...
1113111111121.content:
You're not giving up so easily this time. You're going to get this guy to talk to you, and he will answer.

"Look Gill, I'm already in this deep enough. I don't think a few more answers for my questions will change anything. Come on, help a friend out."

Gill's eyes widened when you said the word 'friend' to him. He looked down at the counter, definitely thinking it over. You glance back at Lyle, who seems to be relaxing on his lifeguard chair. Gill looks back up to you, a glint in his yellow eyes.

"Alright, fine. But if I think the question is too deep, I'm not talking." he said.

You smile, glad to finally be getting something useful around here. First off, you ask him about Lyle and his body, especially about what you saw earlier.

"Yeah, that was a part of his real body. Like Luke, Lyle's body is based off of a pokémon. I can't say which, though. I already told you about Luke as a lucario. You'll have to figure it out yourself."

You nod, taking another glance at Lyle. He's now looking at your direction, a big smile plastered on his face. You see Gill stick out his tongue at him, which only elicits a laugh from Lyle. "Man, that guy's so sure of himself." he said. Next, you ask about the others. Are they also in human disguises, like the twins?

"Yup. None of us are really human at all. We're only human so long as we have a...Well, as long as you're here."

You're unsure how to respond to that, so you just move on to your next question. You ask him why he hates Lyle so much, and you see Gill clench his fists, anger creeping onto his face.

"T-that's...Personal. You have to understand, I can't just...You know, share it with any new person I meet."

You nod your head and assure him you understand, and won't ask about it again until he's ready. You try another question, this time about Luke. Why is he so loyal to Wil, and so willing to go through...Well, all kinds of things? At least, from your impression of him, and from what you know so far.

"None of us are really sure why. Some believe it's because Luke's loyalty just works that way. Others...They think that Luke owes his entire life to him. As for me, I'd say that Luke just has a thing for Wil. In fact, I wouldn't be surprised if he had a picture of Wil on a shrine in his room!"

Gill bursts out laughing, and you're not sure if he was joking or not. You see Lyle sit down next to you, explaining that Gill always has nonsensical thoughts and ideas running through his head. Gill calms down before explaining that he was completely joking. It's too ridiculous of an idea for Luke to be infatuated with Wil in any way. For one, they're both male.

"It's a perk that Gill has, being childish. He's like the third member of Akira and Elly's team. Those three play quite well, you see. Gill, a Belly-Filler, if you don't mind."

Gill begins taking out some bottles from behind the counter, mixing them together, shaking them, and then pouring it all into a glass. Lyle grabs his drink and sips it occasionally. Gill has already returned the bottles and is now chatting with you once more. You can't help but smile a little as the serious atmosphere has lightened up a bit.

"Well, at least it's good to see that you two aren't at each other's throats right now." you say.

"Yeah, we despise each other. But Luke and Wil said that they'll turn us into mince meat if we start fighting." Gill said.

You nod your head as Lyle seems to make a purring sound after every sip he makes from his drink. You look at him as he closes his eyes in bliss, his free hand occasionally rubbing his flat belly whenever he drinks. You just turn your gaze to Gill, expecting him to give an explanation. He catches your sight and just smiles.

"You'll have to drink one yourself if you wanna know why." he said.

You look back at Lyle, who's already finished his drink. Now he's moaning in delight as he rubs his two hands on his stomach, opening one eye to look at you.

"This faux body doesn't change, but my real one is experiencing the effects right now." he said, continuing his delighted moaning.

You're somewhat tempted to try one yourself, but you already know that it will cause another change on your body. You look down at your part crocodile, part human body and admire the powerfully built physique. The drink is called a Belly-Filler, so it will most definitely have some effect on your stomach. Right now, you're pretty sure you don't want anything to happen to your rock-hard abs, but Lyle seems to be really ecstatic from it...

You shake your head and focus your mind back to the task at hand.

"So, I'd like to know more about you, Gill." you say.

"Oh me? Well...Hmm, I like the colour red. I'm usually pretty cheerful and happy. I like to play games, but I like eating food more..."

You just smile and nod your head as Gill seems to be content describing himself to you.

"And I'm the one with the imagination." Gill says rather harshly.

"You know! The one about this world not being the first one that you guys messed with!"

"What ever do you mean?" he asked, his smiling widening into a sneer.
