"Unless..."Lyle said, his voice barely a whisper.

You look back at him, and he gestures to the pool. "I like a good challenge." he tells you.

You look at the pool and think hard. You're a muscular reptile that spends most days in the water. Right now, it would seem that Lyle is expecting you to challenge him to a race, or something. It's almost as if he wants to lose! Unless...But right now, you need more information. You need to know just who these people are!

"...Lyle, how about a race?" you ask.

"Oh? What kind of race?"

"We'll race from one end of the pool to the other. If I win, you have to answer my questions."

"And if I win, then you have to take part in another experiment."

You wince at this. It was already a big risk with what Lyle had you drink. But was it really worth the risk?

"...F-fine then!"
-----
"Okay, are both swimmers ready?" Gill called out.

You were standing a few feet away from Lyle, who smirked in your direction. You waited as Gill began counting down.

"3, 2, 1...Go!"

With that, you jump into the pool. You're not that great of a swimmer, but your animal instincts suddenly kick in. You begin stroking your arms and legs in the water, moving your tail in time as well. You thought that you were doing good progress, until you took a peek at Lyle.

"W-what the!?" you think to yourself.

What you see could almost be described as a bird. A large, white and blue bird with huge, wing-like hands that are propelling him through the water with great ease. He was already ahead of you by the time you stopped gawking.

"O-oh no...I am not gonna be experimented on again!"

You swim faster, harder, working to push yourself as far as you can go. When you reach the other end, Lyle was already about to swim back to Gill. You kick the pool's wall as you flip and twist underwater, trying to give yourself as much push as you can to get ahead of Lyle. The end was in side, and you two were snout-and-beak. Lyle pushed forward with his hands and tail, and you do the same. You reach out and grab the edge of the pool, your head breaking through the water's surface.

"Gah! Hah...So Gill, who won?" you ask.

You glance at Lyle, who seemed to be smiling widely. He catches your gaze and shows his pointed teeth. Admittedly, this is the first time you've ever seen a bird with teeth in its beak.

"Well, the winner is..." Gill says.
111311111112121.title: The Race

113.content:
You decide that it's best to ask the manager, Wil, some questions. You head back the way you came. When you reach the lobby, you feel the same intense feeling in your body again. It looks like Luke is there, standing right next to the receptionists desk. Great, now you gotta watch what you say in front of this guy.

You calmly walk over, trying to mask your fear."Can I help you?"Wil asked, a smile on his face. You can't help but feel like he's mocking you and daring you to bad mouth him in front of Luke. "Uh, yeah. I was, uh, wondering what other things you have in this place." "Oh, we have lots of things to do here! First is the gym somewhere in the right wing, then a nice swimming pool out back. If you'd like, there's also a buffet section in the cafeteria, but you'll have to ask the chef there if you wanna use that section."

"I'll take you to whichever choice you make."Luke said, staring at you dead in the eyes. You try to think it over, but you start to feel like you'd faint from being right next to him! Hurry, where are you gonna go?
113.title: What Else Is There?

choices: Start exercising now, if you don't mind.
Know you better, so let's chat!
1131.content:
"I will guide you immediately." Luke said, strolling away to the hall behind him.
You follow him close by, but you stay as far as three feet away from him, at least. After a few more hallways, the two of you come to a pair of double-doors with the sign "Gym" above it. Luke starts making his way back to the lobby as you look at the double-doors in front of you. You always thought that you need to work out more. Not that you were out of shape, or anything like that. It's just that you have a little trouble when it comes to lifting heavy objects. As you push open the doors, you're shocked to see just how insanely big the inside is! The ceiling has got to be at least 20 or 30 feet high! But what strikes you odd the most is how big the cabin itself looked from the outside. Something weird is going on around here, but you should as might as well go inside and try something.

Inside, you see lots of different training equipment, and it seems that there's already someone inside. He notices you and walks over, slightly sweaty from using the dumbbells. He was a blonde-haired boy, about the same age as Wil and Luke. He was wearing a red shirt and blue pants. The thing about him that really caught your eye was that he had scarlet-red eyes, which kinda made you cringe a little bit. "Hi there! My name is Drake, nice to meet you!" You shake hands and ask him what he does here. "Oh, I just help out the guests with their training and exercise. Stuff like that." He grabbed his arm as he flexed it, not really showing any bulging muscles at all. "You know, it's strange. I work out here a lot, but I don't get any stronger at all. Oh well, the others say I look better thin anyway." You look at all the exercise equipment and decide to try the dumbbells he was using. You take a few steps before he stops you. "W-wait, I have to ask you something. Would you like a drink before working out? It might give you...animal-like strength, so to speak..." "You want me to drink something first?" "Uh huh! But you don't have to drink it if you don't want to. Heck, we can just chat here for a while and not even work out at all!" he says, smiling. "Well, I'd like to..."
1131.title: Working Out?

11311.content:
"Well, I'd like to try out that drink, please!" you say eagerly. "Certainly, sir!" Drake says before walking to a closet at the corner. You watch as he comes back holding a bottle in his hand. "Here you go!" he says, holding it out to you. You take the bottle and examine it. It was filled with a red liquid, which kinda made you think of blood...

"Is there a problem?" Drake asks. "Oh, nothing really. It's just that, it sorta looks like blood." "Well don't worry. I'm not a vampire, that's just ridiculous. But if you see scales on me, then you're just hallucinating." Where did that comment come from? Oh well. As you're about to drink it, you think that maybe it's best to know just what you're going to drink. "Hey, Drake." "Yeah?" "What is this stuff anyway?" "...That's just a Tiger Power Up drink..." Strange, you've never heard of a drink like that before. "But...If you really don't like it, I can get you the Dragon's Fire Power drink instead..."

Drake is looking at you impatiently, as if he's anxious to see you drink something. But since you've never even heard of these two drinks before, Who knows what might happen! But if you keep this guy waiting any longer, then what if he decides to call Luke or something? Better choose one already...
11311.title: Animal-like strength, huh?

113112.content:
"Um, I think I'd rather go with the Dragon's Fire Power drink." Drake suddenly beamed with joy at your choice, which was really, really awkward...for you. "Really? Honest and Truly?" Drake said, his hands clasped together. "Uh...yeah?" Drake quick swiped the Tiger Power Up drink from your hand and ran toward the closet again. You could've sworn he was saying something. "Finally! I'll...have another...around here! And they...said that..." You couldn't quite make out the rest of his mumbling. When he returned, he gave you a bottle with a green liquid inside. Well, a green color for a drink is at least more...normal-ish, sort of. You screw off the cap and look at Drake, who was smiling happily at you. You start drinking the contents of the bottle. Surprisingly, it tasted much better than you expected! Most exercise drinks tasted more like fruit water, or something, but this was totally worth at least more than ten times that flavor!

After finishing off the bottle, you set it down on a table at the side. "Okay, now I'm ready to go!" you say eagerly. Drake just wags a finger in front of you. "Sorry, but I think you gotta wait for the drink to digest first." You don't fully understand what he meant by that. Usually, it's okay to exercise even right after drinking something. That's when your skin started itching. You scratch it a bit before the itch comes back, and it's getting a bit more irritated! "Gah! Why am i so itchy all of a sudden!?" You start scratching your back, front, arms, legs, everything! What you don't notice is Drake getting something from the closet again and sitting down on the bleachers on one wall, watching you. As you continue to scratch yourself, you start feeling something harder than skin...You look down at your arms and see scales...Green scales! And it's spreading all over your arm! "Wh-what the!?" You look around and see Drake staring at you. He gives a friendly wave to you before you feel something in your pants. You feel around your back, only to be surprised when a long reptilian tail bursts out of it! Not only that, but the scales have already spread all across your body! Your face grows out a snout, with slits for nostrils, fangs, and even you hair fell off! You felt your back go completely numb, as two stubs pushed out from your shirt. As quickly as they appeared, two green scaly wings ripped through your shirt, folding themselves neatly on your back. As you feel your whole body finally settle to the changes, you look at your clawed hands and your taloned feet. Drake walks over to you with something in his hand. "Well, that was a pleasant change, now wasn't it?" "...What did you do to me?" Drake held out a hand mirror, showing the reflection of a green anthropomorphic dragon. You stare at your reflection, your mouth open in horror. "Well, now I've finally got someone to help me out now!" You grab Drake by the collar of his shirt, something warm building up inside your throat. "Change me back...Now." "Sorry, but I'm not allowed to. And besides, I'm not the one who you should make your enemy." You needed more answers from him, so burning him alive wouldn't do any good. You let him go, anger slightly subsiding now. "Anyway, I bet you're wondering what I meant by 'I'm not allowed to,' aren't you?" You nod as you take a quick glance at the gym doors. No one. "Well, I guess I can explain it to you."

The two of you sit down at the bleachers, with you keeping an eye on him the whole time. "You see, I'm supposed to make sure anyone who enters the gym has to drink something. Otherwise, Wil is gonna punish me for insubordination." "What do you mean? What kind of punishment would he do? And why would he even want you to do this in the first place?" "Sorry, but all I can tell you is that the punishment is extremely painful and, sometimes, even traumatizing." You start imagining a bunch of horrible scenes and pictures in your mind. "Woah, that's just not right." "I know...And he said that if I ever double-cross him, he's gonna serve dragon steak for dinner tonight." Wait a minute, what's he talking about? Wil couldn't have possibly have known that you chose to drink that Dragon's Fire Power stuff, and Drake isn't a dragon...But the way he acted, and the stuff he said...No way, he can't possibly be...

Drake leaned on his knees for a bit, covering his face a little with his arms. "And worse of all, he said that he has no use to a pawn that doesn't follow orders." You see some red scales begin to appear on his arm, starting from the inside of his shirt. "Uh, Drake..." "Yeah?" he looks at you with his scarlet-red eyes. "You said that if you had red scales, then I'm just hallucinating, right?" "Yeah?" "Well, I'm seeing some right now...on your arm." He looks at his arms, and saw the red scales reaching his shoulders. "Gah! ah, I, uh, th-this is...just an allergic reaction! Yeah, I'm actually allergic to, uh, to dust. And these bleachers haven't been cleaned in a while, so, ah, I-I'll be right back!" Drake stood up and left for the same closet. He tripped on the last step of the seats, and fell flat on the floor. "Hey, you okay?" you say, standing up from your seat. "I, I'm fine!" he said, his voice sounding a little bit...rougher.
113112.title: Dragon's Fire Power

1131121.content:
Drake gets up and reaches in the closet. You watch as he starts drinking a whole bottle of something. When he puts the bottle down, empty, he walks back over to you. "Phew! That could've been ugly!" he says, all the weird changes on his body completely gone. You can't help but wonder what he just drank back there. "Hey Drake." "Yeah? What is it?" "What was that you drank back there?" "Oh...um, well, it's just, uh, my medicine..." You can already tell he was lying the way he keeps fidgeting around. You get up from the bleachers and walk closer to him, trying to get a better look at him. "Oh really? So you drink an entire bottle of medicine everyday?" "...Yes. That's how bad my allergies are." Drake was looking away from you now. "I don't believe it. No one has allergies that bad. Even if it causes red scales to spread all over, and make your voice change too." Drake was staring at the door now, as if hoping someone would come and stop the conversation. But no one came, heck no one even passed by. "I...I...I..." "Drake...Tell me the truth...What are you?" Drake gave out a sigh and looked at you in the eye. "...I'm a dragon."

The two of you were sitting on the bleachers again, with Drake telling you about himself. "I was born as a dragon, but I was completely alone for some reason. I think I might have been abandoned by my parents, or my egg got lost somehow. I don't really know. All I remember is that Wil found me one night, and I've been so loyal to him ever since. Even though he treats me like his own brother, sometimes...He would treat me in a completely different way." You suddenly remember the horrible images you imagined earlier. "You mean he would start hurting you?" "Yeah...But I don't blame him. I think there's something wrong inside him, something that might be causing him to do that. Maybe..." You were going to ask him some more questions until the door suddenly burst open, Luke standing there.

"Drake, you're being summoned by our master. It's time for our daily meeting." You feel the intense cold feeling, but it's not as strong as it was last time. "Alright, I'm coming!" Drake said before Luke left the gym. "Sorry, I gotta go. Remember this though, Luke is much more loyal to Wil than I am. So be careful around him!" Drake left the gym as well, leaving you alone inside. You see the closet wide open. "Looks like he forgot to close the cabinet door..." You walk over to it to see a large number of bottles inside, all full of different colored fluids. Some bottles were labeled in english, but most of the bottles were labeled with a bunch of runes you've never seen before. "Does he have his own draconic language or something?" You shrug your shoulders as you look for the empty bottle Drake had drunk, but it seems to be hidden in the back. Oh well, guess you'll just take your chances and get a random one and hope for the best.
1131121.title: A Temporary Antidote

choices: You make it back to your room
11311212.content:
After some looking around, you find a bottle with a clear, transparent fluid. Once again, the label was in a weird rune-like language that you couldn't understand. "Hopefully, this is what he drank, or something else might happen to me!" You take the bottle and unscrew the cap. You smell it first, getting a slightly sweet aroma from the drink. "This seems nice...Bottoms up!" You begin chugging the bottle down into your gullet. As the last drop fell into your throat, you give a satisfied sigh as you replace the cap and put the now empty bottle back. Looking at the door and seeing no one behind it, you close the cabinet doors and wait for something to happen. That was when you felt it. A small gurgling sensation in your stomach. "Looks like something's gonna happen now!" you say, excitedly.

You felt your arms tingling. You look at them and realize that they're bulking up! The muscles were slowly expanding, growing underneath your green scales! "Whoa! Didn't expect this to happen..." You feel the same tingling sensation throughout your entire body. Your calves began to shake a little, growing underneath your frame. Your chest expanding and pushing out your shirt. Even your stomach had the same sensation as your body. You remember the small mirror that Drake handed to you earlier. You walk over to where it is and look, but it's too small! Thought it really doesn't matter much, cause you're still growing! You rub your 6-pack abs, becoming an 8-pack. Your biceps are blowing up to basketball size. Your calves growing longer, adding a few inches of height to your expanding body. When it finally stopped, you look at your body in astonishment. You're a rippling mass of pure dragon muscle! You flex your arm in front of you, gaping at the sheer size of it. You pound your own chest, and feel nothing at all! "This is amazing!!!" you say to yourself.

You look around at the gym equipment, excited to try out your new strength. Your first thought was the empty weightlifting bar. You pile up as much as 200lbs. on it and lie down on the bench press. Your firmly grab the bar and lift. It's surprisingly light and easy to lift! You even try lifting it with one hand with no problem at all! You try 500lbs. and still too easy! Finally, you put up to 800lbs on the bar. The moment you push, you feel some resistance as the weights try to push your arms down. You decide to try and put some effort to it, and the weights finally gave in on the first try! You set the bar back and look at your arms again. "This is so cool! Why would Drake never even try drinking that stuff when he knew just exercising wouldn't do a thing?"

As you sit down on the bleachers again to wait for Drake to come back, a thought enters your mind. "Wait...How could I be so stupid! It's too obvious for them to not see me suddenly turn into a reptilian beefcake after like 10 minutes! I'd better get outta here before anyone comes to check on me here!" You stand up and check the gym doors before exiting. On both sides, you only see hallways leading to more hallways. "Great, I don't even know how to get back! Looks like I'll have to depend on my luck and senses now. Hope no one finds me..." You set off to the first corridor you see, moving towards the left.
11311212.title: Muscle Dragon

choices: It was...Luke? He looks like Luke...
113112121.content:
As you walk down the corridor, you spot a fork in your path, going to the left and right. You look down both choices and hear footsteps coming. A shadow appears on the left corridor. "Crud! Someone's coming!" Hastily, you run down the right, trying to avoid being seen. Several near encounters happen as you rush towards your room, not even sure if this is the path to your room. "Darn it, where the heck am I!?" You run down every twist and turn you see. The cabin is definitely a lot bigger inside than out. You're already sure that you're lost somewhere in this maze-like building, and you're already getting tired out from your constant running. Just when you're almost out of hope, you see another branch of corridors, with voices coming from one of them. As silent as you can, you lean forward, trying to listen in on the voices. "...Man, I hate redecorating. Can't we just leave it the way it is? I'm sure the guest wouldn't mind at all." "Guilmon, you remember what Wolfy told us, right? We have to keep him comfortable until..." The voices stopped talking. You felt a chill creep down your spine. It gets worse and worse until your whole body is shuddering violently. "W-what's going on?" Your legs tremble, threatening to collapse from your shaking body. You can't seem to move a single muscle. This experience can only mean one thing. "Luke..." Managing to move your back and head, even just a little, you manage to peak out and see two kids standing in front of a door. Sure enough, the black cloak on one of them means that Luke really is there. The figure standing next to him, the boy he called Guilmon, is trembling as well. "Lucario, can you p-please back off with your aura, just a little bit? I-I can barely move a muscle!" You recover as your massive body stops trembling. "Gill, it's time to go. Aren't you in the middle of cooking something?" "Oh, darn it, you're right!" The two head off towards a different direction, leaving you free to check out the room they were in. But from their conversation about redecorating and about you..."This must be my room!"

Upon entering, the whole room was definitely very different compared to when you first entered it. The walls were now a beige colour, with medieval torch-shaped lights. There were several jewel-encrusted furniture such as chairs, a desk, a cabinet, and even the bed was jewel-encrusted! But there was someone lying on your bed. He had a wispy, dreamy look on his face, with a small smile etched onto his mouth. "Wil!" you shout, approaching him. He seems unsurprised as he lazily stands up from your bed. "Yo. How ya doin', dragon guy." "What did you do to my room!?" "Redecorated it. It's gonna be on your tab once your stay's over." A tab!? You feel like punching him now! You instinctively growl and clench your fists tightly. You can already feel your arms tensing as you're ready to unleash hell on this kid. "Calm down! This whole stay is complementary, so everything is no charge, remember? That includes the redecorated room. Besides, don't you feel more at home in this kind of place?" He did have a point. Looking around your room did soothe you a little bit, if not a little too 'dragon's hoard' themed for your taste. Taking a deep breath, you control your anger for the time being and look at Wil. He seems to have taken a liking at one of the torches, staring at it intensely. "Alright, I admit, I like this new room. But please, if you're gonna mess with my stuff, get my permission first." "You mean like how you messed around with Drake's medicine cabinet?" You froze up. How did he know about that? Wil laughed at your reaction. "Isn't it a little too obvious? You were an ordinary human when you got here. And now, you're a hulking green dragon with muscle tone good to win the world championships!" You think over what he said and laugh a little yourself. It is really that obvious, actually.

The two of you sit down on your bed, chatting about the other workers. "So who is this Guilmon I saw Luke talking to?" "Oh, he's the chef of the cafeteria. We usually call him Gill." "Is it because he's named after that digimon character?" "Yup, it's a little embarrassing if you're going around with a character's name as your own name." "Yeah, that's understandable. Anyway, about Drake...Is it really true that he's a dragon?" "He told you? Well in that case, I have no reason to keep it from you. Yes, he's a dragon. He has to drink his medicine to temporarily take on the form of a human, but it always wears off after a while. One of the things he can do is force his dragon form to come out though, but then he'll have to take his medicine earlier than usual." "Huh. But, what about me? I drank some of that Dragon's Fire Power stuff, and now I'm a dragon. Won't I..." Wil looked sullen, looking away from you. "I'm sorry, but it won't wear off for a very long time." "What!? W-Why not!?" "You drank a muscle growth formula on top of that energy drink. The result would have changed your genetic structure, causing the changes to become permanent." Your heart sinks into your stomach, as the thought of living as something inhuman for the rest of your life burns into your mind. "But look at it this way! With those guns, no woman can possibly resist you now!" Wil says casually. A long, uneasy silence settles in as neither of you says a word. Suddenly, Wil gets up and stretches his arms. "Welp! No use being all gloomy about it now! Besides, your strength may serve you well in the future..." Wil smiles at you creepily, as if he's saying something to you. But you're not sure exactly what it is. "Well, no one's manning the front desk. Back to my post!" Immediately, he runs out of your room, not even bothering to close the door. Sighing, you get up to close the door when someone walks up in front of it.
113112121.title: Room Redecorations

choices: you accept the offer, and Lyle gives you a weird-looking serum.
Drake suddenly appears and chases Lyle away.
1131121212.content:
As you push the doors closed, something stops it from the other side. You step back as someone pushes the door fully open and looks at you. The person standing before you looked very much like Luke, but he didn't have a black cloak, nor did he give off that intimidating aura. Instead, he wore a white shirt with a blue front, and white shoes and glasses. Another thing that made him very different was that smile. This guy had a smile that just shouted 'bad news'.

"Why hello there, valuable guest." he said, his sneer getting bigger.

You can't help it, but something inside you is just screaming at you not to trust this guy!

"And who, may I ask, are you?" You said.

"Why, I'm Lyle. Luke's twin brother. Why, didn't he tell you anything about me?"

"No, he didn't. And I'm fairly certain the others didn't either."

"Hmm, shame..."

He looks at you from top to bottom, from horn tip to foot claws. He had his smile the entire time, and it kept growing wider and wider as he observed you. Finally, you decide to ask.

"What are you looking at?" "Oh, I just wanted to get a closer look at you, ever since you became a large green anthropomorphic dragon with very good muscle tone..."

Ugh, he knows about you too? Does everyone know about what you did!? Wait, does Drake know it too?

"Well anyway, you seem like a very decent piece of work. Though I do still want to perform a few experiments..." Lyle said, turning away.

You suddenly realize what he just said, and you grab onto his shoulder and turn him back towards you.

"Wait, a few experiments? So, are you the one who makes Drake's medicine? Then you can cure me, right!?"

"Heh, heheheheh...A cure? Oh, I might have something for you...If you're willing to take the risk. It's untested, and I have no data on what may happen."

"Really? Oh...W-well..."
1131121212.title: Meet The Mad Scientist

choices: You two spend some more time chatting.
11311212122.content:
You were thinking it over. You seriously didn't like this guy, much less trust him with your body! But, if he really did have a cure...

"Heheheh, if you're not gonna give me an answer, then I'll be happy to answer my question for you." Lyle said.

He grabbed hold of your arm with one hand, and had a syringe in the other! He took you by surprise, and you didn't have enough time to react! It was a split second, but before this jerk could jab the needle into your scales, something knocked it away. You caught a glimpse of something red, until you managed to see what had jumped on Lyle. It was a red dragon anthro, just like you, only thin and athletic-looking, instead of your bodybuilder-like physique. He was grappling with Lyle, trying to knock the syringe out of his hands.

"You will not do ANY experiment on him, you hear me!?" He shouted.

"Guh...Dracus! Why'd you have to interrupt me, of all times!" Lyle shouted.

The two grappled until Lyle had let go of the syringe. Then, this Dracus person quickly stood up and crushed it underfoot. Lyle looked pretty mad, shouting something about coming back before running off. You felt really thankful of him now. You walked up to him and placed a scaly hand on his shoulder.

"H-hey, um...Thanks for saving me back there..." You say.

"O-oh, uh, well...Yeah, of course I would! What are friends for?" he said.

It was then when something in your mind just clicked. You suddenly recognize his voice, which was slightly gruffer than when you last remembered. It sounded a lot more threatening in the heat of the moment, but now that he was calm, you recognize it.

"D-Drake!? Is that...Really you?" you ask.

"Yeah, heheh, it's me. Are you surprised?"
-----
The two of you are in your room now, talking things over. You confessed about messing around with his medicine, but he doesn't hold it against you in the least. He insisted that the only thing he cared about was that you were safe. In return, he admitted that that was his true form, and that "Drake" wasn't his real name.

"It's Dracus. You see, my boss Wil insisted that we all use faux names whenever we're around guests and other people. He...Well, he just doesn't seem to trust other people with our real names." he explained.

"But, why would he make you all use different names instead? I mean, why keep your real names a secret?" you asked.

"I really have no idea! The only explanation he would give us is that revealing your real name will reveal the entrance to your soul..."

"...What? Is Wil always cryptic like that?"

"I dunno. It's just his thing, I guess."
11311212122.title: A Friend In Need

choices: There's a feast in your honor.
There's a staff party, and you're invited!
113112121221.content:
You were thinking of what to say to Dracus, when the door suddenly bursts open. You look...And see Wil there, eyes agleam and a smile on his face.

"Drake! I'm starting a staff meeting in 6 minutes. Everyone is to attend. Go and say goodbye to your friend, and let's go!" he said.

Dracus turns to you, an apologetic smile on his face. "Sorry, buddy. I gotta go."

You just nod as he stands up and walks away. Wil just stands there in front of your door, smiling at you. It was getting a little creepy, to be honest.

"Mr. Guest. You have been enjoying your stay here, haven't you?" he asked.

"W-well...It's been interesting, so...Yeah, a little bit!" you admit.

"Oh, good...It's getting a little late, and we don't want you missing your beauty sleep, now do we?"

Wil holds up a small figurine, which kinda looks a bit like a red dragon. He whispers something as a sudden burst of drowsiness hits you. Your vision instantly blurs as a loud yawn escapes your lips. Your body becomes heavy as you fall onto your bed, your eyes barely able to stay open.

"Sleep tightly now, honored guest..."

The last thing you remember seeing is his smile growing wide, his mouth full of sharp beastly fangs.
-----
"Well now, is everyone here?" Wil asked.

"All are present and accounted for, sir." Luke answered.

"Pfhe. I have more important work to do, than to attend meaningless meetings." Lyle says, fiddling with his glasses.

"So...What is the reason for this meeting, sir?" Dracus asked.

"It's about...Our dear guest." Wil answered, a sneer growing over his lips.

"Ooh! Are we finally gonna dissect him?" Lyle asked, smiling widely.

"What have I told you, Lugia!? No one harms my precious toy!" Wil yelled, growling audibly at his employee.

"Keep your claws hidden, Wolfy. I've just finished waxing the table." Luke said, not even looking.

Wil took a deep breath, and his smile returned to his face. "Don't worry, Lucario. I'm calm."

"So, tell me again, why are we having this meeting? So far, you only told us that it's about our guest." Dracus asked.

"Ah, that. You see, it would seem that our green muscle-dragon has began to lose trust in us, thanks to a certain someone." Wil said, glancing at Lyle.

"So, what do you suggest we do to put him back into a state of safety?" Luke asked.

"Easy. We whip up a nice, delicious feast. Are you ready for it, Guilmon?"

A boy with red hair and yellow eyes looked at everyone, a grin dancing on his face. "I'm finally getting a chance to test out a new recipe!" he declared, his grin widening ever so slightly.
-----
You groan as the sunlight burns your eyelids. You sit up on your bed, shaking your head back and forth. Then, the memories come back to you.

"Dracus! Wil...W-what..."

A knock on the door made you jump a little. You turn to it as you groggily get up to answer it. When you look out, you see two little kids, no older than 6. You remember the two, who opened the door for you. The girl and boy were both smiling up at you, as if they were trick-or-treaters on Halloween night.

"We have a message for you, Dragon man!" the boy tells you.

"It came from straight at the top! Wil sent it to you!" the girl said.

You're shocked awake as they giggle to each other. They then tell you the message...
113112121221.title: Staff Meeting

1131121212212.content:
"W-wait, what?" you ask blankly.

"Didn't you hear us? We're having a party, and we want you in it!" the boy said.

"B-but, I'm not a staff member." you said.

"But it would be so lonely if you missed out on the fun! That's why Wil is inviting you over!" the girl said, grabbing hold of one of your arms.

Before you could respond, the two grab you by the arm and yank you along with them. You travel through a number of hallways until you come up to a large door with a sign that said "Cafeteria" at the top. You can hear some muttering coming through the door, and you guess that everyone must be inside.

"C'mon! Let's go!"

The two open the door and drag you along inside. In the large room, you see a large round table filled with various dishes, from T-bone stake, to vegetable stew, you guess that the chefs must have worked hard on this. There were party decorations all over the walls, streamers and ribbons covering the area. Wil approaches you with a big smile.

"Hey hey! Glad you could make it! I think I should introduce you to everyone, don't you?" Wil said happily.

You just stare at him blankly as he continues to smile at you. Then the two little kids line up behind him as Wil makes a sweeping gesture to them.

"This is Akira and Elly! They handle the door and greetings!" Wil explains.

You just smile and nod your head. With that, the two wander to another section of the room. You don't have time to worry about them, though, as you feel a shiver crawl up your spine. Luke casually approaches you as Wil gestures to him like he's a trophy being presented.

"This is Luke! He's my personal assistant, and the most dependable around here. You have a problem, take it up to him!" Will said.

"Just don't annoy me, or you'll regret it." Luke said, staring at you in the eye.

You just nod as he walks away. Then, Wil calls over Dracus and the guy who looks like Luke. You glare at him for a little as they approach.

"This is Drake and Lyle. I'm sure you're already acquainted with Drake, and you've encountered Lyle before. They're the gym instructor and pool lifeguard respectively. Play nice now!" Wil said.

"You will be my experiment subject." Lyle said, a smile growing on his face.

You and Dracus glare at him as he walks away laughing. "Don't worry. Nothing's gonna happen while I'm here." Dracus assured you.

"And, let's not forget the one who cooked up this great feast of ours! Gill! Come over here!" Wil called out.

You hear some crashes as a boy with red hair rushes out of the kitchen. He stops in front of you and bows.

"My name is Gill, and I'm the chef. It is very nice to meet you." he said.

"No, please! The pleasure is all mine." you said.

When Gill stands back up, you notice the eerie yellow of his eyes.

"Okay gang, food time!" Wil shouts.

And just like that, everyone takes a seat around the large table, piling their plates with various foodstuff to eat. You take your own seat and begin eating yourself. It was heavenly! The flavor was delicious, and you continued to eat more and more. Suddenly, you feel a strange rumbling in your stomach. That's when you notice it.
1131121212212.title: It's Party Time!

11313.content:
"Let's just talk," you say, taking a seat on some bleachers alongside the gym walls.

"Sure, okay," Drake replies and jumps up on them and takes a seat a bit further up than you. He leaned back and stretched and for a moment you were sure you saw a few red scales on his smooth preteen armpits. Then he finished and you lost sight of them, though it, together with a bunch of other things, was making you wonder. "So I'm Drake, I'm the trainer here, but you know all that. What about you?"

"Oh, um, I'm Michael and I'm seventeen. I used to live near here then I moved when I was seven, and I just moved back last week."

"Nice. What made you come out to visit us?" Drake asked.

"Well I used to come to this spot a lot when I was little. It was sort of my own little spot where I could be by myself, or sometimes play with my friends," you explained, "So I wanted to visit my spot and I found your little cottage here and, well, here I am."

"Oh, I'm sorry," Drake said, "We didn't know we were setting up on a spot special to someone."

"It's... well it's not okay, but it belongs to the forest I guess," you sigh, "So I guess I forgive you. But what are you all exactly?"

"What do you mean?" Drake asked, though there was an edge of nervousness to his voice. "We're just a bunch of kids living in the woods."

"No you're not," you reply. You weren't brilliant, but you were smart enough to know something odd when you saw it. These weren't just kids, and you could see that easily. "Luke's spooky, Wil's way more authoritative than a twelve-year old could possibly be, and you have red eyes and scales."

"I don't have scales," Drake protested with a laugh, "You're seeing things dude."

"Perhaps, but there's plenty of other things off about this place. It's bigger on the inside for example."

"Oh, no it, uh, it just looks smaller outside than it actually is," Drake stuttered, clearly not good at lying.

"And does Luke normally stalk people simply for living near this place?"

"No, he just- come on man, I'm not good at this sorta thing," Drake whined, sounding more and more nervous.

Well that confirmed one thing; Luke had definitely been stalking you before, which explained that uncomfortable feeling at home. You weren't really sure about anything else, but you had your suspicions. Still, it was probably best to avoid annoying these kids too much, especially with Luke around. Or Drake even, if he really was what you suspected him to be. "Alright, so let's get to working out," you say, "What kind of drinks do you have?"

"Oh! Well I have Dragon Fire, Tiger Blood, not real blood mind you, and Pumped Up," Drake explained, his cheeriness restored.

"Okay, well I guess I'll have..."
11313.title: Know you better, so let's chat!

113131.content:
"I'll have either Dragon Fire or Tiger Blood." you say.

"Um, Michael, can you please specify which one?" Drake says, tilting his head slightly.

"Yeah, about that. I've never heard of any of those drinks before, so I'd like to see those two myself."

"Understandable." Drake says, shrugging his shoulders.

He stand up from his seat and heads towards a small closet on the side. Drake comes back holding two bottles in his hands. He gives it to you, so you can examine it more thoroughly. The Dragon Fire bottle has a picture of a dragon's head breathing fire, with the name spelled out with the flames forming letters. As for the Tiger Blood drink, it had a picture of a burly tiger flexing one arm, with the name written on the large tiger's bicep. You look back at Drake, who just shrugs again.

"So, are you gonna drink one or not? I'm not allowed to let you have more than one drink."

Wait, you can only drink one of them? Oh well, you're kinda curious about the taste anyway...
113131.title: Dragon Fire or Tiger Blood

1132.content:
"Hey, there can't possibly be a pool out back! There is no out back at all! This cabin is sitting at the edge of a cliff, remember?" you say, your insides feeling a little warmer, but still icy cold from Luke. "Oh, I beg to differ." Wil says, smiling at your confusion. "We do have a pool out back. Luke, can you kindly show him the way?" "Yes sir." he says, immediately walking away.

You quickly follow after him, sprinting a little bit. You stop and stay at around three feet behind him, so you can feel the horrid sensation the least while still able to keep a visual on him. After a short while, you're lead to a pair of glass double doors, with the sun shining through it. As Luke leaves, you peer inside and gasp as you see a huge swimming pool, right there in the sunlight! It took you a few seconds to realize that you look ridiculous staring through the door like that, so you enter the swimming pool area.

You look around and see a tall lifeguard's chair to the side, and there's someone there! You walk closer and see that it's Luke! "Hey, Luke! Is that you?" He sees you and jumps off the chair. "Nope, sorry. If I was, then I bet your insides would be getting frozen into an ice sculpture right now." He's right. He seems more active than Luke...And nicer, since you're not getting the same feeling off of him. "Anyway, my name's Lyle, Ly for short, but no one ever uses that one. But if you'd like, you can just call me some other names that start with 'L' such as Lee, or Lucian...or Lu...uh...Lenard, and um...Hmm...Darn, I'm all out..." Well, at least he's not acting scary like Luke. "So, Lyle...Can I go swimming?" "Sure! We've got a changing room around here, so you can change clothes if you'd like. Or better yet, how about you swim right NOW!!!"

Lyle grabs you by the shirt and 'lightly' pushes you toward the water. You manage to regain your balance a few steps away from the water. "Hey! What the heck was that for!?" you shout. "Hahahahaha! You don't know? Didn't Wil tell you that everything here has a special little side effect on the guests?" Your head starts filling with questions. But why would he try to make you go swimming like that? It's like he wants to see what happens..."Heheheh, alright...I'll tell you all about the side effects that can happen in this place. If you were to jump into that special water I made in my lab the other day." Special water from his lab? Does he mean the pool water!? No way would you want to come in contact with any unknown chemicals, not from this madman, er, boy. But, he said he'll tell you everything about the effects in this weird cabin...But who knows what'll happen to you if you jump in that pool! Are you willing to take that chance?
1132.title: The Pool

11321.content:
"If I jump into this water, will you really tell me what I wanna know?" "Yeah, sure, whatever." "No! You gotta promise me that you'll tell me!" "Fine, fine, I promise." You turn around and look at the water. It looks normal enough, like water from any old pool. You really don't wanna go in there, but if it means learning what you need to know, then there's no other choice here...

You jump in, making a big splash and almost hitting Lyle with the water, almost. As you float to the top, nothing happens...so far. Lyle walks to the edge and crouches down to get a closer look on you. "Okay, I jumped into your dumb lab water, now tell me everything!" "Tsk, tsk, tsk, not yet I will..." You start feeling a strange sensation on you backside, neck, and fingertips. You feel your back and find a growing bulge underneath your pants! Your body suddenly feels numb, and you can't seem to move. "Wh-what's...happening?" you say, looking at Lyle. He starts smiling, sitting on the very edge of the pool, his feet submerged in the pool water. Unable to feel your body or move it, all you can do is float on the water's surface, watching Lyle smile at you as he splashes a bit with his feet.

When all feeling finally returns to you, you move around a bit, feeling another strange sensation. Your body seems normal, but there's also something about it that's not normal. "If you're confused about what happened, I suggest taking a better look at your body." You turn around in the water, trying to look at yourself. You see blue skin, a tail, webbed feet and hands...What the heck happened to you!? "Here." Lyle stretches out his hand, offering to pull you up. You decide to let him help you up, even though he didn't do much considering the fact that he's still sitting on the pool edge. You look at the rippling water, and almost make out a head...Wait, that's a shark's head! You touch your face and find it pointing down and in front of your face! You must've thought your nose in front of you was just the water. "What the? I'm...I'm a shark!" "That's right, at least, you're half a shark. You still have webbed hands and feet, and you're also capable of breathing in and out of water." You get the urge to bite his head off and rip the rest of his body into pieces. You try to control yourself, however, since he still hasn't told you what you wanted to know.

"Alright, now you'd better tell me right now, everything you know here, before I get impatient and bite off your arm!" "Hehehe, alright already. I'll tell you." He stands up in front of you, and begins walking around you. Your urge grows stronger and stronger, until you notice something. His feet, they were in the pool water the whole time, but it's still human! "Oh, you noticed? Heheh, I'm not gonna share my secret of course, but I will share Wil's secret about the cabin." Lyle walks to a chair and sits down. He invites you to a chair next to him, so you sit there. "What I'm about to tell you is strictly confidential. Don't tell Wil or Luke that I told you all of this. You see, Wil is looking for a new toy to play with, so we built this cabin to attract unsuspecting victims. The thing is, Wil is completely relentless when it comes to playing with toys, so they tend to...break after a while." You gulp after hearing the word break. If you were the newest toy, how did all the other toys break? "Anyway, some of us disapproved his idea, and they ended up...punished severely for it. Luke completely lost his emotions, and can only feel what Wil wants him to feel." "That's impossible! How can anyone lose their emotions?" "Well, Luke went through a traumatic experience when he spoke his mind to Wil, and ever since then, he's had that horrible cold air around him." You shudder at the mere mention of the sensation you felt when Luke was nearby. "So now, none of us have the courage to stand up to Wil, even if we were to join together. And, Luke was also turned into Wil's puppet, always following his directions. Only once or twice have I seen him question his command, or even ignore it completely. I think Luke still remembers how to feel for others, or something. Anyway, Luke is Wil's eyes and ears. That's all you need to know about him." You nod, understanding some of the things Lyle told you. "One last thing you do need to know. Wil likes to distort reality a lot, so he wants us to enjoy morphing the toys' body a lot. And the change I've done is turn you into an anthropomorphic shark. And besides, if we don't do our jobs, he'll punish us until we do it. I don't plan on having to go through it again, believe me." Lyle stands up and jumps into the pool. "Hey! What are you doing!? That water'll turn you into whatever!" "Nah, it doesn't work on me!" You remember his feet again. "I suggest you go now! Or someone will check up on you!" You stand up and look at yourself. Your pants are torn, but that's all the damaged that's been done. You head to the doors, and look back to see Lyle coming out of the pool, still human. As you head inside the cabin, you're unsure of what to do next.
11321.title: The Pool's effects

113212.content:
You decide to go try getting some more info from the other employees around the cabin. Except, you're not exactly sure just where to start. You wander around for a little bit before you spot a sign above some double doors. "The gym? I guess someone's bound to be inside there." You cautiously open the door and look inside. The place was huge! It's gotta be about 3 stories big in there! "Whoa...Is this place another distorted reality like what Lyle told me?" You scan the place and spot no one using any of the workout machines inside. You shrug your shoulders as you turn back to look for someplace else. When you close the door and look behind you...

"What do you think you're doing?" You freeze as you see a blonde kid wearing a red shirt and blue pants looking at you curiously. "Ah, I was just, um..." You try to think up of a good excuse to use. "Hey Drake! I'm back with the snacks! Huh? Who's this guy?" You see a red-haired boy run up to the first employee holding a bunch of snacks in his arms. "I was just getting to that, Gill." Drake said. The two look at you inquiringly and you feel more and more uneasy. "Ah, I was just, um...Looking for some help!" "Really? What kind of help?" Drake asked. "Well, I met Lyle, you see, and-" "What!? You met Lyle!!! Is that why you're a shark-man!?" The boy named Gill shouted. "Er...yes..." "Well why didn't you say so? Come with us." Drake said, leading you into the gym. You have no other choice but to follow the two inside. You all sit down on the bleachers on one wall as they began asking you if you're alright. You tell them everything that happened at the pool. "Oh, don't let him get to you. He just loves doing these things to people." Drake said, stroking the fin on your back. "He's a total jerk! Straight and simple!" Gill said, laying down the snacks in front of him. "Yeah, but is everything he said really true?" you ask. The two nod their heads, and you start feeling a bit sorry for Luke. "You know, another strange fact is Luke happens to be Lyle's twin brother, yet they have completely different personalities." Drake said. "Yeah, I kinda already noticed that." "Just be careful around him. If he's causing you any trouble, just call on Luke!" Gill said. "What!? But I thought Luke was supposed to be bad news!" "We know, but he's also the only real person that Lyle would listen to. He only sometimes listens to Wil, and that's saying something." Drake said, looking at his hands, as if checking something.

You notice something very odd. Gill brought a lot of snacks with him, but no one has even started opening a single one! "Hey, uh, just what are all those supposed to even be for?" you ask, pointing to the pile of junk food in front him. "Oh, this is just some experimental stuff that I got from Wil. He said that we should try testing them out when we have time. You wanna try it out?" "Ah...What does it even do exactly?" "Dunno, but I hear it's supposed to give someone great power." Drake said, grabbing a bag and inspecting the back. You feel like trying out one of the bags to find out if it's true. "Or make them plump out like a marshmallow!" You look at Gill with a surprised face. He just smiles back at you. "*sigh* If I'm gonna be up against someone that can distort reality to his whim, I might as well try raising my chances of survival." You reach out to grab...
113212.title: Unsuspecting Encounter

1132122.content:
You tear open the white bag, seeing the snacks inside. They look like perfectly normal potato chips. You look at the others, who aren't eating any themselves. You shrug as you begin eating it one by one. They were pretty tasty, and you begin eating it by the handful. Before you even realize it, the bag was already empty. You reach out for another one, but Drake suddenly grabs your outstretched arm.

"Whoa there, you have to let the snacks take effect before you start eating another bag!"

You just nod as you patiently wait there. In a minute, you could feel your stomach grumbling as you let out a light burp. Your whole body starts feeling a little warm as you look yourself over.

"Hey, did you work out recently?" Gill asked.

You just stare at him, irritated that he would ask something like that. You've been sitting there with them! You expected him to be a little smarter than that. But, you do feel a little warm. Also, your clothes feel a little tighter than before.

"Hey...You're growing!" Drake said.

You look at yourself and realize that he was right! You were originally thin and lithe, but now there are visible muscles on your frame! You flex one arm and see the bicep make a small mound of muscle on it, with a small vein to compliment it too!

"Wow, this is amazing!" you say.

You feel your body getting warmer, and your muscles grow bigger and bigger! You've got baseball-sized biceps, quads the size of small trees, washboard abs, and it all continues to grow! You decide and test your strength. You walk up to a dumbbell on the ground and lay you webbed hands around the bar. You see the two kids eying you eagerly, waiting for you to lift the heavy weights. You pull, and the weights come up to your chest. With another heave, you lift it above your head. The two clap and applaud as you drop the bar. They immediately set heavier weights for you to lift. When they're done, they tell you it's worth 300 lbs.

"300!?" you say. You've never lifted that much before!

They just urge you on as you comply. Your muscles are still growing, and you hope that you're ready for this. With a few heaves, you actually manage to get it off the ground! But there's still the final challenge. You push, inching the bar above your head bit by bit. And soon, you hear their applause and cheering once more. You've just lifted 300 lbs. on your first try! You drop the bar and make a pose as the two continue to cheer on for you. You bring a flexed arm to your face and kiss it, loving this turn of events! Soon, your body no longer feels warm and...
1132122.title: The White Bag

11323.content:
Suddenly, you hear the doors of the swimming pool flap open. The two of you look to see Luke standing by the doors, glaring daggers at Lyle. He briskly walks towards him, and you see that Lyle has tensed up, a look of fear in his eyes. You can almost feel the animosity Luke is permeating in your own bones.

"What do you think you're doing?" Luke asks.

"I...Wanted to let the guest take a dip in the pool." Lyle said, looking away.

"Well, it's a good thing I didn't really leave. I was by the door when I saw you start talking with the guest, and I saw you try to push him into the experimental water."

Experimental water? So the pool water really is from a lab! Lyle merely scratches his neck as Luke stares him down with eyes that could pierce through your soul.

"Don't mistreat the guests. Understand? I'm only warning you this one time. If I ever catch wind of any misbehavior from you, I will end you."

Lyle quickly nods his head, his breathing going shallow as Luke just stood there. Then, Luke blinks a few times before facing you, the cold feeling ebbing away.

"If he ever mistreats you, please do not hesitate to report him to Wil, or me. We will deal with him accordingly."

"Y-yes sir!" you say.

With that, he bows his head a little before turning to the door and walking out. Lyle lets out a deep breath as he slumps to the ground, hands on his head.

"That was close. Too close. Way too close." he mutters to himself.

Now you're presented with a choice. You could ask him about the side effects he was talking about earlier. But, how to do it?
11323.title: Twin Psychos

114.content:
Deciding to see exactly what had taken away your favorite hiding place, you wandered the hall outside your hotel room. Some of the doors you passed were open and you peered inside, seeing no harm in being curious. Through one door, you saw what appeared to be a little girl's room with pink walls, a white canopy bed and dresser, and a white vanity with dolls and stuffed animals on the floor in one corner. Curiously, you were tempted to walk in but you held back, not wanting to anger anyone for invading their private space. "Cute." whispering, you said. "It must belong to one of the younger girls who work here.

Moving on, you saw another open door. Looking inside, you were surprised to find a boy's bedroom that looked much like your room did when you were six years old. Again, you felt the urge to walk inside, just to look around but shrugged it off, knowing it was not right to do so. "I wonder whose bedroom this belongs to." mussing, you said. "He might be surprised to know I played with the same toys as a kid."

Chuckling at the thought, you continued down the hall to find another open door and peered inside to find what looked like a play room. There, he saw a six year old boy with black hair wearing a blue hooded shirt dancing to a catchy instrumental tune with a six year old girl with long blonde hair wearing a dress made of pink feathers. You smiled, watching them and were greatly tempted to join them. You found that you had to force yourself to step away from the door, not wanting to spoil their childhood fun but you could not get yourself to move on or even move back to your own room. Something was calling you to one of the three rooms you had peered into and the urge was not about to stop nagging at you.

"I can't just walk into a child's bedroom." disturbed, you thought. "It's wrong, I have no business to do such a thing."

"You have a good heart, sir." startling you, a voice said.

You spun around to find a twelve year old boy with scarlet-red eyes, a red shirt and blue pants. "S-Sorry." blushing, you said. "I did not see you at first."

The boy shrugged. "I am Drake, the gym trainer." smiling, he said. "I'm sure Akira and Elly would not mind you entering their rooms as long as you ask them first." he pointed into the playroom. "The song is almost over, now would be a good time to knock and ask them. Just be ready for a little 'fun' if you do ask to enter."

With that said, he walked away, just as the music stopped. You were not sure what to make of how Drake said 'fun' but the urge to enter one of the three rooms was still nagging at you. What do you do?
114.title: Explore the hotel

1141.content:
I politely knocked on the door as the song stopped and Elly answered. "Oh, hi!" smiling, she said. "You must be our new guest, how can we help you?"

"Yes, well..." you blushed slightly. "Forget it... it's silly..."

"Don't be shy, mister." walking to the door, Akira said. "What's on your mind?"

"I heard the music and saw you two dancing and I was tempted to join you." blushing more, you replied. "Only it would not be right... an adult playing with children."

Elly giggled and motioned you to come closer. You knelled down to her level and she touched your nose. There was a slight spark, making you feel dizzy but, when your vision cleared, you were suddenly standing eye to eye with the two six year olds! "Now you are a child too." smiling, Elly giggled. "We can change you back after we are done playing, okay?"

To say I was startled was would have been an understatement but I somehow felt calm about it. "I- I guess that's okay." seeing you were wearing children's clothing, you said. "What shall we play first."

"That depends upon who you want to play with first." smiling, Akira replied. "If you decide to play with Elly, you will likely play house or with dolls. If you decide to play with me first, you will might play hide and seek or with cars."

Who do you decide to play with first?

info.brief_description: You've been trapped by 7 "kids", who are not as they appear. Can you escape? Probably not.
info.description:
You decide to visit your usual secret spot in the forest, right next to a beautiful seaside cliff. Only, you see a big cottage house there, and it wasn't there before too. After you decide to visit the place, you're met with seven kids, five of which are twelve year olds, the other two are six. The thing is, they enjoy doing all kinds of things to visitors, and they're not gonna let go of their newest toy. Can you get out?

-You can make the character look like he/she is enjoying it or not.
-You can make him/her gain weight/muscle, transform to an animal/anthro, grow to macro sizes, etc.
-No adult anything, unless really necessary. And I mean really necessary.
-After some years of this interactive existing on the site, I've decided to be more lenient with adult things. Chapters that involve nudity, description of certain parts, and romantic advances are considered okay. Straight-up sex will need to be kept brief, with half the chapter length at max. Other than that, you're free to be descriptive of it if you want.
-The kids should always look like they're toying with the main character, or trying to get the main character to believe whatever they tell him/her. Something like that. It's just their thing, you know? Good.
Other than the above, just write whatever you want, okay?

Character update:
Wil - The manager/receptionist/mastermind. He's about twelve years old with brown hair and blue eyes. He's also the leader, the way the others act and talk about him. He seems to be watching the whole game with the use of a chess board and pieces. He's the werewolf piece. He has dark secrets about the other kids...

Luke/Lucario - The guard/guide/spy/bellboy of sorts. He's twelve years old and wears a long black cape that covers most of his body. He rarely ever talks, and only focuses on the task given to him by Wil. He's very loyal to him, but sometimes helps the guest, maybe. He's the blue dog piece. He has a very cold air about him, like whoever isn't used to being with him will die from over-intimidation. His true form is the Aura PokÃ©mon. Seems to have personal issues with twin brother Lyle.

Gill/Guilmon - The chef/resident knucklehead. He's also twelve years old with red hair and wears a blue bandanna on his left arm. He's the red T-Rex piece. He enjoys both cooking and eating food, but mostly the eating part, even though he's thin.
